meaningMnemonic:
<kanji>Send back</kanji> to the <kanji>origin</kanji> means you are going to <vocabulary>give something back</vocabulary>. This word is commonly used to mean "giving benefits back to the consumers.” For example, if a company makes more money than usual, they can thank consumers with a 利益還元 sale, lowering prices to "give back" some of the profits.

In the context of chemistry, 還元 also means <vocabulary>reduction</vocabulary>, like reducing an oxidized substance back to its original, unoxidized form.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
